intro: Scorzonera luristanica, commonly known as the Luristan scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is known for its edible tuberous roots, which have been historically used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Scorzonera luristanica typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, contributing to its resilience in its native habitat.
